intro: Fitzgeraldia mitrastigma, commonly known as the Mitre-crested Fitzgeraldia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine and subalpine regions. Fitzgeraldia mitrastigma is an important component of New Zealand's native flora and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its habitat.
